intro: Saussurea gnaphalodes, commonly known as the Indian lovegrass, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas and parts of South Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and fibrous root system. The plant typically grows in high-altitude regions, often in rocky or alpine environments. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences. Saussurea gnaphalodes is valued for its ornamental appeal and has traditional uses in herbal medicine.
